intro: Couepia cognata, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or purple in color. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a rough texture. Couepia cognata is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of habitats including forests and open areas.
